Literature Review: The evolution of atmospheric oxygen levels has been a subject of interest for scientists studying the history of life on Earth. Understanding the rise and maintenance of high O2 levels is crucial for investigating what drove the evolution of complex animals and assessing the likely habitability of exoplanets. In this review, we assess the methods used to reconstruct past variation in oxygen levels over the Phanerozoic Eon and produce a consensus plot of the most likely evolution of atmospheric oxygen levels.
